<center>
The Environmental Science Research Pathway is built around the
Louisiana Freshwater Sponge Project. This research
project is a longitudinal study designed to continuously
monitor the freshwater sponge population in Louisiana.
</center>
<br>
<br>

<center>
![](drone_picture_lake_bistineaux.jpg){width=75%}
</center>
<center>
<font size="1"> Pictured above: Some of the Louisiana Freshwater Sponge Hunters out field surveying. </font>
</center>
<br>
<br>

**The Pathway is designed to:**
<br>
- Increase scientific professional skills, including communication, literacy, and teamwork.
<br>
- Prepare students with technical skills to enter the job force.
<br>
- Provide high-wage employment while gaining skills.
<br>
- Grow the STEM field with diverse researchers.
<br>
<br>

Pathway Participants will progress through 4-tiers:
<br>
_**1. Summer Internships:**_ Selected incoming freshmen participate in a summer research
experience ($2500).
<br>
_**2. Louisiana Freshwater Sponge Project Interns:**_ Conduct research at BRCC while taking their
first 30 hours of coursework ($15/hr).
<br>
_**3. Near-Peer Research Mentors:**_ After completing 30 hours of coursework and 500 research
hours, interns will be promoted to mentors ($16/hr).
<br>
_**4. Externs:**_ Within 12 hours of graduation, students will be placed in an externship with a local
environmental science agency ($18.50/hr).
<br>
<br>

**Benefits!**
<br>
- Paid through continuous employment, participants will have the opportunity to gain
transferable skills, including computer coding, microscopy, working with DNA, water
analysis, field collection research techniques, and many more!
<br>
- Participate in all-expense-paid field research trips and conferences (hotel, meal per
diem, registration, and airfare).
<br>
- Receive paid leadership training for near-peer mentors.
<br>
- Build your resume with skills and presentations.
<br>
- Network with four-year institutions and environmental science professionals.
<br>
<br>

**Who is eligible to apply?**
<br>
- Incoming freshmen or current BRCC students who have completed fewer than 13 credit
hours.
<br>
- Enroll at BRCC for Fall 2024.
<br>
- Major in: Associate of Science General Science, Associate of Science Louisiana Transfer,
Associate of Science Pre-Engineering, or Associate of Science Computer Science.
<br>
- Interest in pursuing an environmental science career.
<br>
<br>

**Application Process**
<br>
- Complete the online application at http://tiny.cc/g1vkwz by April 12th.
<br>
- Participate in a formal interview with the BRCC Pathway team.
<br>
- If accepted, you will receive a letter of acceptance by May 13th.
<br>
<br>

**Requirements to stay in the Pathway**
<br>
- Participation in the 200-hour paid summer workshop (online and lab meetings).
<br>
- Maintain a minimum GPA of 2.0.
<br>
- Enroll in 9-15 credit hours each semester.
<br>
- Conduct 12-20 hours per week of paid research at BRCC.
<br>
- Participate in research outreach events.
<br>
- Contribute to a positive teamwork environment.
<br>
- Present research at local conferences.
